revised_title: Experiments on the Brain of Monkeys: A Study of the Effects of Ablation and Destruction of Localized Regions
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on monkeys to study the effects of ablation and destruction of localized regions in the brain. They used various methods, such as the cautery, to remove specific parts of the brain and observed the resulting changes in the monkeys' behavior. The experiments showed that the antero-frontal regions of the hemispheres were responsible for motion and sensation, while other parts played a role in curiosity, attention, and response to stimuli.
